Pair_Alignment

Jeff Lansing

2025-02-12

Source: vignettes/Pair_Alignment.Rmd
Pair_Alignment.Rmd
.caption {
  margin: auto;
  text-align: center;
}

Introduction

The goal of this vignette is to use the common expansion of a polyhedron π\pi and its dual δ\delta as a way to align π\pi with δ\delta. (For now we assume without proof that the two expansions are equal. But we can see an illustration for eT and for edT, which is the case for the tetrahedron and its dual).

rad <- rhombic_dodecahedron
tet <- tetrahedron
dtet <- dual_tetrahedron
rad$texts <- NULL
display_poly(rad, dual = tet, codual = dtet, scale = 1.5, theta = 103, phi = 7, zoom = 0.65)
#> Warning in text3d(poly$verts, texts = poly$texts): No text to plot

Figure 1. A rhombic dodecahedron containing tetrahedra
